sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均可表示"整体的一部分"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: part, piece, section, division, portion, fraction, fragment, segment, share
means: part ： 含义广，最普通用词。常指整体中可大可小的一部分，也可指整体中可分开的独立部分。
piece ： 指整体中的一些个体，尤指从某个整体上分出来的一部分。
section ： 指整体中的分区，部分与部分之间有显著界限。
division ： 通常指按类划分或分割成而的部分。常含抽象意义。
portion ： 侧重从整体中所分配到的那一部分，含一定的独立意义。
fraction ： 指包含在全体中的一部分，暗示微不足道的一部分。
fragment ： 指因破裂、分割等产生的支离破碎、不规则的一部分。
segment ： 指某物的特定部分或自然形成的部分，也指线形物品的一段。
share ： 指共有的东西中应占有的一部分。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个动词均含有"分享，分担"之意。
means: share ： 普通用词，指与他人共同享受拥有或共同使用某物，或共同承担某项工作或费用等。
participate ： 主要指参与某事。

sentence.Network_en: Share prices and trading have been dulled by worries over the war.
sentence.Network_cn: 股票价格和交易因人们对战争的忧虑而走低。

jx.jx_en_mean: have or receive an equal share

lj.lj_ly: I've no money—we all share and share alike in camp.
lj.lj_ls: 我没有钱——我们都得在营地里分享一切。

jx.jx_en_mean: To be concerned or partake equally or jointly, as in a business venture.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 分享，分担：同时或共同参与或承担，如在商业风险中

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English scearu 'division, part into which something may be divided', of Germanic origin; related to Dutch schare and German Schar 'troop, multitude', also to shear. The verb dates from the late 16th cent

encyclopedia.content: Share是由日本的一位程序员所开发的P2P软件。他的功能基本上与Winny相同，但是在一定程度上更加容易使用，所以也逐渐被日本本土外的电脑...

entry.def: A company's shares are the many equal parts into which its ownership is divided. Shares can be bought by people as an investment.

example.ex: This is why Sir Colin Marshall, British Airways' chairman, has been so keen to buy shares in US-AIR...
example.tran: 这就是为什么英国航空公司主席科林·马歇尔爵士一直如此热衷于购买美国航空公司的股票。

example.ex: For some months the share price remained fairly static.
example.tran: 有那么几个月，股票价格一直非常地稳定。

entry.def: If you share something with another person, you both have it, use it, or occupy it. You can also say that two people share something.

example.ex: ...the small income he had shared with his brother from his father's estate...
example.tran: 他兄弟二人从父亲那里继承的一小笔遗产

example.ex: Two Americans will share this year's Nobel Prize for Medicine...
example.tran: 两名美国人将共同摘得今年的诺贝尔医学奖。

entry.tran: 共同承担，分担，分摊(任务、责任等)
entry.def: If you share a task, duty, or responsibility with someone, you each carry out or accept part of it. You can also say that two people share something.

example.ex: You can find out whether they are prepared to share the cost of the flowers with you...
example.tran: 你可以弄清楚他们是否愿意和你一起分担买花的费用。

example.ex: The republics have worked out a plan for sharing control of nuclear weapons.
example.tran: 一些共和国已经制订出共同控制核武器的计划。

entry.tran: 分享，共同拥有(同样的经历)
entry.def: If you share an experience with someone, you have the same experience, often because you are with them at the time. You can also say that two people share something.

example.ex: Yes, I want to share my life with you...
example.tran: 是的，我想和你共度一生。

example.ex: I felt we both shared the same sense of loss, felt the same pain.
example.tran: 我觉得我们两个有着共同的失落感，经受着同样的痛苦。

entry.def: If you share someone's opinion, you agree with them.

example.ex: We share his view that business can be a positive force for change...
example.tran: 我们同意他的观点，认为商业可以是促进变革的一种积极力量。

example.ex: Prosperity and economic success remain popular and broadly shared goals.
example.tran: 经济繁荣昌盛一直是各国普遍追求的共同目标。

entry.tran: 共同具有(某种品质和特点);和…有共同之处
entry.def: If one person or thing shares a quality or characteristic with another, they have the same quality or characteristic. You can also say that two people or things share something.

example.ex: ...newspapers which share similar characteristics with certain British newspapers.
example.tran: 和英国的某些报纸风格相似的一些报纸

example.ex: ...two groups who share a common language.
example.tran: 说同一种语言的两个人群

entry.def: If you share something that you have with someone, you give some of it to them or let them use it.

example.ex: The village tribe is friendly and they share their water supply with you...
example.tran: 村里的部落很友善，他们会和你一起分享水源。

example.ex: Scientists now have to compete for funding, and do not share information among themselves...
example.tran: 科学家们现在为了资金不得不相互竞争，互相之间也不会共享信息。

entry.tran: 向…诉说,与…分享(想法、消息等)
entry.def: If you share something personal such as a thought or a piece of news with someone, you tell them about it.

example.ex: It can be beneficial to share your feelings with someone you trust...
example.tran: 向自己信任的人倾诉感情是很有益处的。

example.ex: Film critic Bob Mondello shares his thoughts on the movie 'City of Hope'.
example.tran: 影评家鲍勃·蒙德洛和大家分享他对电影《希望之城》的看法。

entry.def: If something is divided or distributed among a number of different people or things, each of them has, or is responsible for, a share of it.

example.ex: Sara also pays a share of the gas, electricity and phone bills...
example.tran: 萨拉也分摊燃气费、电费和电话费。

example.ex: He is counting on winning seats and perhaps a share in the new government of Macedonia.
example.tran: 他正期望着能赢得一些席位，或许还能成为马其顿新政府的一员。

entry.tran: 应得的一份;应做的一份
entry.def: If you have or do your share of something, you have or do an amount that seems reasonable to you, or to other people.

example.ex: Women must receive their fair share of training for good-paying jobs...
example.tran: 女性必须获得她们理应得到的高薪工作培训。

example.ex: I have had more than my full share of adventures.
example.tran: 我已经有了太多丰富多彩的历险。

means.word_mean: 1. any of the equal portions into which the capital stock of a corporation is divided and ownership of which is evidenced by a stock certificate;

sentences.sentence: "he bought 100 shares of IBM at the market price"

means.word_mean: 2. assets belonging to or due to or contributed by an individual person or group;
3. the result of parcelling out or sharing;

sentences.sentence: "death gets more than its share of attention from theologicans"

means.word_mean: 4. any one of a number of individual efforts in a common endeavor;

sentences.sentence: "I am proud of my contribution to the team's success"
"they all did their share of the work"

means.word_mean: 5. a sharp steel wedge that cuts loose the top layer of soil

sentences.sentence: "Our children share a love of music"
"The two countries share a long border"

means.word_mean: 3. have, give, or receive a share of;
4. give out as one's portion or share

sentences.sentence: "I'd like to share this idea with you"

auth_sentence.res_content: Ceefax has had its fair share of celebrity callers.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Ceefax has had its fair share of celebrity callers.

auth_sentence.content: They'll see that these consultants share their concerns.
auth_sentence.res_content: They'll see that these consultants share their concerns.

Sentence.sentence: By last year, Wall Street traders, bankers and those who deal in real estate generated 21% of the national income, double their share in the 1950s.

Both strains quickly invaded local hospitals when needle sharing and other unhealthy practices ensured the rapid spreading of the infection by bringing people into contact with contaminated body fluids.
Users pick their favourite song of the week to share with others.

sentences.en: I gave him a minor share of my wealth.
sentences.cn: 我把小部分财产给了他。

sentences.en: I've had more than my fair share of troubles in my time.
sentences.cn: 我在任期内遇到了不少麻烦。

sentences.en: I deem it advisable to purchase the shares in the railway now.
sentences.cn: 我认为现在购买铁路股票是明智的。

means.word_mean: 共有, 共用, 均摊, 参与

sentences.cn: 小孩应该学会与人分享东西。
你愿意和我共用这把伞吗?

sentences.en: They shared the cake between them.
After his death his property was shared between his children.
sentences.cn: 他死后, 财产由孩子们平分。

sentences.en: I will share in the cost with you.

jushi.english: What share did he have in their success?
jushi.chinese: 在他们的成绩中他有何贡献?

jushi.english: Everyone must have a fair share.
jushi.chinese: 人人都应该获得公平的份额。

jushi.english: Everyone who helped gets a share in the profits.
jushi.chinese: 凡是帮过忙的就可得到一份利润。
